intro: Ardisia tetramera, commonly known as the four-merous ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrsinaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are glossy and dark green in color. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by bright red berries that are attractive to birds. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and colorful fruit.
